alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 10:30PM AKST until March 01 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A storm force low is moving towards the northern gulf coast and will stall out during the day on Wednesday. Snow has began to spread over the northern panhandle tonight and will continue to move south through Wednesday. Temperatures are remaining below freezing with dewpoints in the 20s. All communities throughout SEAK are still expected to see snow but some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow will cause a mix of rain/snow or even a complete change to rain through Wednesday evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central inner channels. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall expected late Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. Snow could mix with rain Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
